Inference: Soil moisture rising immediately after rain detections indicates effective rainfall absorption
Description: When rain events pause irrigation and soil moisture increases at the same time, the soil is efficiently capturing rainwater.
short rationale: Environmental moisture response only; no person-level detail.

Inference: Soil moisture remaining unchanged after rain detections suggests light rainfall or poor infiltration
Description: If moisture levels do not rise following rain-triggered pauses, rainfall may be too weak or soil infiltration may be limited.
short rationale: Shows weak rain/infiltration; site trait, minimal privacy exposure.

Inference: Soil moisture declining despite frequent rain detections indicates insufficient rainfall intensity
Description: Multiple rain events that fail to lift moisture suggest drizzle or minimal precipitation.
short rationale: Weather intensity insight only; no behavioral signal.

Inference: Large soil moisture spikes following rain detections indicate heavy rainfall events
Description: If moisture jumps sharply after rain pauses, rainfall was strong enough to saturate the soil quickly.
short rationale: Strong rainfall indicator only; no user or identity link.

Inference: Soil moisture increasing more during rain-triggered pauses than during irrigation cycles indicates rain is more effective than irrigation
Description: Rainwater may penetrate deeper or spread more evenly than artificial watering.
short rationale: Compares rain vs irrigation effectiveness; mild operational insight.

Inference: Soil moisture saturation occurring repeatedly during periods with many rain detections indicates prolonged wet spells
Description: Moisture reaches near-maximum levels each time rainfall occurs, suggesting continuous or intense rainy conditions.
short rationale: Extended wet-climate signal; no personal behavior implied.

Inference: Infrequent rain detections paired with slow soil moisture decline indicate high soil water retention
Description: Even with few rain events, moisture decreases gradually, meaning the soil holds water well.
short rationale: Soil retention trait; environmental, not personal.

Inference: Infrequent rain detections paired with rapid soil moisture decline indicate poor soil retention or high evapotranspiration
Description: Soil dries quickly when rainfall is rare, signaling environmental or soil-based drying pressures.
short rationale: Drying tendency only; minimal privacy relevance.

Inference: Soil moisture rising before the recorded rain detection indicates early rainfall onset or sensor delay
Description: Moisture may respond faster than the rain detection signal, suggesting sensor timing offsets.
short rationale: Reveals timing misalignment/sensor lag; mild operational detail.

Inference: Soil moisture rising *after* a significant delay from the rain detection suggests slow percolation
Description: The soil may take longer to absorb rainfall, especially if the surface layer is compacted or hydrophobic.
short rationale: Highlights soil permeability characteristics; weak privacy risk.

Inference: Soil moisture dropping quickly after rain-driven increases indicates fast-draining or sandy soil
Description: High percolation removes water rapidly after rainfall events.
short rationale: Soil type inference only; no behavioral exposure.

Inference: Soil moisture staying elevated long after rain detections indicates clayey or poorly drained soil
Description: Moisture lingers because water cannot drain efficiently.
short rationale: Drainage trait insight; minimal privacy impact.

Inference: Low soil moisture during long gaps between rain detections indicates drought stress
Description: Extended periods without rainfall correlate with soil moisture depletion.
short rationale: Drought signal only; no person-level data.

Inference: Soil moisture remaining stable during long gaps between rain detections suggests vegetation or shading reduces water loss
Description: Moisture does not fall significantly despite dry weather, indicating low evapotranspiration.
short rationale: Suggests site vegetation/shade patterns; mild context exposure.

Inference: High frequency of rain detections paired with constantly low soil moisture indicates rainfall not reaching the root zone
Description: Rain may be blocked by canopy cover, evaporating quickly, or insufficient in volume to penetrate deeply.
short rationale: Implies canopy/coverage blocking rain; reveals site layout lightly.

Inference: High frequency of rain detections paired with stable high soil moisture indicates rainfall dominance in hydration
Description: Natural rain alone maintains moisture without requiring irrigation.
short rationale: Rain-dominant hydration insight; no behavioral tie.

Inference: Rain detections consistently occurring when soil moisture is already high indicate the system pauses irrigation appropriately
Description: The system avoids overwatering by halting irrigation when rainfall is present and moisture is sufficient.
short rationale: Shows irrigation control behavior/config; mild operational exposure.

Inference: Rain detections occurring when soil moisture is low indicate light rainfall insufficient to replenish soil moisture
Description: Rain is detected but does not meaningfully improve moisture levels.
short rationale: Weak rain cue only; no user behavior.

Inference: Sharp soil moisture spikes during rain detection periods indicate direct rainfall impact near the sensor
Description: Rainfall directly reaches and saturates the region around the moisture sensor.
short rationale: Reveals sensor placement/local exposure; minor contextual signal.

Inference: Very small soil moisture increases during heavy rain detection clustering indicate deep sensor placement
Description: Rainfall affects surface layers strongly but has limited effect at deeper soil levels.
short rationale: Discloses sensor installation depth; operational detail only.

Inference: Soil moisture decreasing during rain detection periods suggests sensor or hardware malfunction
Description: Moisture should rise or stabilize during rain; declining values indicate anomalous behavior.
short rationale: Indicates device fault/maintenance needs; operational behavior exposure.

Inference: Soil moisture increasing inconsistently across rain detections indicates variable rainfall intensity
Description: Some rainfall events are strong enough to raise soil moisture while others are too weak.
short rationale: Variability in weather only; negligible privacy risk.

Inference: Steady moisture increases across successive rain detections indicate cumulative rainfall saturation
Description: Each rainfall event builds on the previous one, steadily increasing soil water levels.
short rationale: Cumulative weather effect; no personal signal.

Inference: Moisture increases that plateau even with multiple rain detections indicate soil saturation limits
Description: Once the soil reaches capacity, additional rainfall produces no further moisture rise.
short rationale: Soil capacity insight; minimal privacy exposure.

Inference: Moisture failing to fully recover between rain detections indicates persistent environmental drying forces
Description: Soil loses water faster than rainfall replenishes it.
short rationale: Drying pressure cue only; no behavioral data.

Inference: Strong correlation between rain detections and moisture rise indicates high-quality sensor alignment
Description: Moisture readings and rainfall detection match consistently, showing reliable sensor feedback.
short rationale: Reflects maintenance/calibration quality; mild operational signal.

Inference: Weak correlation between rain detections and moisture changes suggests calibration or placement issues
Description: Rainfall events do not produce expected moisture changes, implying sensor misalignment.
short rationale: Shows sensor misplacement/calibration gap; limited privacy risk.

Inference: Soil moisture rising only during heavy rain detections suggests threshold-based rain contribution
Description: Light rain has little effect, but heavy rain increases moisture noticeably.
short rationale: Rain threshold insight; no user linkage.

Inference: Moisture rising modestly during rain and sharply during irrigation indicates irrigation is more effective locally
Description: The sprinkler delivers water more efficiently than rainfall to the monitored zone.
short rationale: Compares irrigation vs rain performance; minor operational exposure.

Inference: Rain detections with identical soil moisture responses across zones indicate uniform rainfall distribution
Description: All monitored locations show equal moisture behavior following rain.
short rationale: Uniform weather effect; no personal detail.

Inference: Rain detections with varied soil moisture responses indicate microclimatic rainfall variation
Description: Some areas receive heavier rainfall than others.
short rationale: Reveals zone-level differences; slight site profiling.

Inference: Rain detection clusters followed by decreasing soil moisture suggest intermittent rainfall insufficient for deep recharge
Description: Rain falls frequently but too lightly to replenish deeper soil layers.
short rationale: Intermittent weather effect only; negligible privacy risk.

Inference: Periods with no rain detections but increasing soil moisture indicate unlogged rainfall or irrigation drift
Description: Moisture rises without rain logs, implying rainfall was missed or water drifted from adjacent zones.
short rationale: Shows unlogged watering/rain events, exposing operational gaps/possible off-cycle watering.

Inference: Periods with rain detections but decreasing moisture indicate evaporation beating rainfall
Description: Insufficient rainfall cannot counter ongoing moisture loss.
short rationale: Environmental evaporation signal; no behavioral link.

Inference: Soil moisture spikes occurring only during rain detections and not during irrigation indicate possible sprinkler malfunction
Description: If irrigation cycles fail to change moisture while rain does, irrigation delivery is impaired.
short rationale: Implies irrigation failure and maintenance needs; operational behavior exposure.

Inference: Soil moisture stability during heavy rain detections suggests sensor burial depth exceeds rainfall penetration
Description: Rain does not reach deeply enough to affect sensor readings.
short rationale: Discloses installation depth/context; minor privacy exposure.

Inference: Repeated moisture spikes with rain detections suggest rainfall as the primary water source for the area
Description: Irrigation may be supplemental while rain events are the major contributors.
short rationale: Hydration source insight only; no personal data.

Inference: Low soil moisture during frequent rain detections indicates canopy interception
Description: Tree cover or structures prevent rainfall from reaching the soil surface.
short rationale: Reveals canopy/structure coverage patterns; mild site profiling.

Inference: Soil moisture drops immediately after rain detection ends indicate rapid surface evaporation
Description: Moisture gained from rainfall evaporates quickly once rain stops.
short rationale: Rapid evaporation cue; no person-level information.

Inference: Soil moisture continues rising after rain detection ends indicating delayed infiltration
Description: Water continues seeping downward into the soil even after rain stops.
short rationale: Infiltration timing only; negligible privacy risk.

Inference: Rain detections that do not alter soil moisture but appear in logs suggest rainfall outside the zone of influence
Description: Rain may fall in areas where sensors detect it but does not reach monitored soil regions.
short rationale: Shows spatial mismatch between sensors/zones; minor operational detail.

Inference: Consistent timing between rain detection and moisture rise indicates system responsiveness
Description: Moisture reacts predictably and promptly to rainfall events.
short rationale: Reveals system timing/performance; mild operational exposure.
